intro: Melaleuca quadrifida subsp. homalophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and striking red or pink bottlebrush flowers that bloom in winter. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal heathlands and open forests. Its nectar-rich flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including honeyeaters and bees.
